Marianna Diamanta and Katia Gatt have been working hard on this new website! No JupyterBook page this time, but a WordPress website! With this new website we’ll promote the TeachBooks community and keep you posted on updates around our tooling, manual, template and on events.

Marianna and Katia are now finalizing the layout of the website. If you’ve any comments, let us know in a GitHub Discussion or send us an email at info@teachbooks.io!

item.title: Automatically update nested books
item.dc:creator: Dennis den Ouden-van der Horst
item.description: We’ve implemented an improved way of updating nested books. Now it’s possible to automatically check for updates of your nested […]
item.content:encoded:
We’ve implemented an improved way of updating nested books. Now it’s possible to automatically check for updates of your nested books and to enforce updates without the need to clone your books and all of its submodules!

Using the out-of-the box GitHub Dependabot, applied to our specific case of nested books, you can make this possible yourself! This is described in our manual! There are options to set the interval on checking for updates or a manual trigger. If there’s an update, a pull request will be created in your repository listing the new commits. In combination with the deploy-book-workflow you can easily preview the update in your browser

item.title: TU Delft Theme release
item.dc:creator: Dennis den Ouden-van der Horst
item.description: v1.0.1 for the TU Delft Theme is released. This is made for lecturers from Delft University of Technology to make […]
item.content:encoded:
v1.0.1 for the TU Delft Theme is released. This is made for lecturers from Delft University of Technology to make sure their books are following their corporate style. However, feel free to fork and reuse it for yourself!

The TU Delft Theme is released as a sphinx extension in this GitHub repository. It’s described in the manual too. Among others, it’s set colours for the various visualisations inside your book:

  • admonitions (e.g. hint, note, tip, error, etc.),
  • exercises,
  • buttons,
  • badges,
  • LaTeX,
  • the primary and secondary color of the book (mainly used for typesetting links),
  • …

and adds:

  • a Delft University of Technology logo;
  • a Delft University of Technology favicon;
  • the Delft University of Technology preferred fonts;
  • …

Check it out at https://github.com/TeachBooks/Sphinx-TUDelft-theme!

item.title: Multilingual book
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: We described how to create multilingual books using our existing extension to create custom buttons in a TeachBook! A while […]
item.content:encoded:
We described how to create multilingual books using our existing extension to create custom buttons in a TeachBook!

A while back, Luuk Fröling created a Sphinx extension which adds an additional button in your TeachBook. Now, Julie Kirsch and Tom van Woudenberg described how to use that effectively to create a multilingual book.

This feature is already implemented in the Files and Folders book! Check it out!

item.title: Exercises in Template
item.dc:creator: Tom van Woudenberg
item.description: We added exercises to our template! With these exercises, we try to get people started a bit more after taking […]
item.content:encoded:
We added exercises to our template! With these exercises, we try to get people started a bit more after taking our template to create their first book.

The exercises focus on the key components of a book: the content, the table of contents and the configuration file. Furthermore, it shows you the potential of git in the book-editing process and how the TeachBooks deploy-book-workflow takes care of all the parsing stuff in the background.

We plan on adding much more exercises, so feel free to contribute!

item.title: Rich tool tips in your TeachBook!
item.dc:creator: Dennis den Ouden-van der Horst
item.description: Sphinx-tippy allows you to create rich hover over tips. Whenever you hower over a link with your mouse, a preview […]
item.content:encoded:
Sphinx-tippy allows you to create rich hover over tips. Whenever you hower over a link with your mouse, a preview is shown with the content of where the link points too. We’ve created a TeachBooks Tippy extension which makes it plug-and-play within a TeachBook.

The repository is part of our TeachBooks GitHub organization. An example book is made to show you how you can use it!

item.title: Grasple extension released
item.dc:creator: Dennis den Ouden-van der Horst
item.description: Earlier, Dani Balagué Guardia, created a Grasple extension, which is now published openly on GitHub and PyPi! The Sphinx Grasple […]
item.content:encoded:
Earlier, Dani Balagué Guardia, created a Grasple extension, which is now published openly on GitHub and PyPi!

The Sphinx Grasple extension makes it possible to easily insert Grasple exercises into a book. It allows you to easily add Grasple question with some formatting and, more importantly, the creation of QR codes in the PDF version of the page.

The repository is on GitHub, and the documentation is also shown in our manual.
